item.description:
NEW STUFF:
The movie starts at 7, so let's meet at 6:30 right inside the theater doors. Then I'll buy our tickets and we can get snacks and head in.

If you're going to be late, need directions or have to change your RSVP after 5:00 p.m. on Thursday, give me a call (508/308-4897).

Hope to see you tomorrow for New Moon!

--Dana

OLD STUFF:
The 2nd installment of the Twilight series by Stephanie Meyer, New Moon, is out and I, for one, can't wait to see it. Now you may be thinking, "Dana -- you're forgetting you don't like horror movies." To which I say, "Vampire movies are not horror movies, thankyouverymuch!" It's true. I've been a vamp buff since the Buffy days. Let's face it, they're interesting and sexy (especially when they're being "good")!

So let's get our fangs on and go see New Moon!

SUMMARY:
Following Bella Swan's ill-fated 18th birthday party, Edward Cullen and his family abandon the town of Forks, Washington, in an effort to protect her from the dangers inherent in their world. As the heartbroken Bella sleepwalks through her senior year of high school, numb and alone, she discovers Edward's image comes to her whenever she puts herself in jeopardy. Her desire to be with him at any cost leads her to take greater and greater risks.

With the help of her childhood friend Jacob Black, Bella refurbishes an old motorbike to carry her on her adventures. Bella's frozen heart is gradually thawed by her budding relationship with Jacob, a member of the mysterious Quileute tribe, who has a supernatural secret of his own.

When a chance encounter brings Bella face to face with a former nemesis, only the intervention of a pack of supernaturally large wolves saves her from a grisly fate, and the encounter makes it frighteningly clear that Bella is still in grave danger. In a race against the clock, Bella learns the secret of the Quileutes and Edward's true motivation for leaving her. She also faces the prospect of a potentially deadly reunion with her beloved that is a far cry from the one she'd hoped for.

THE USUAL STUFF:
We'll meet outside the theater doors and then I can buy us all discounted tickets ($8.00 each for FMM members and their guests). I also have $3 vouchers each for small sodas and small popcorns (can be used towards a larger size). Exact change makes me like you more.

As always, guests are welcome, just be sure to include them in the RSVP so that I know who/how many to expect.

Please keep your RSVP as up-to-date as possible. And please call me if you're going to be late or need to change your RSVP after I close RSVPs on the site (2 hours before we meet). My cell is: 508/308-4897. I'm also good for directions if you get lost.

After the movie, we'll head to Fridays (I'll bring the coupons!) to chat about the movie (and just chat).

I'll update the time a few days before the meetup, so keep an eye on your email!

Hope to see you for Where the New Moon!

--Dana
508/308-4897
item.name: Twilight: New Moon
